## Public Member Functions

### getAddrDiscriminator() {#a21c4bebcfc399209abbf62ccee053836}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; llvm::sandboxir::ConstantPtrAuth::getAddrDiscriminator () const</>}>
The address discriminator if any, or the null constant.

If present, this must be a value equivalent to the storage location of the only global-initializer user of the ptrauth signed pointer.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l01112">1112</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp/#l00446">446</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp">Constant.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### hasSpecialAddressDiscriminator() {#abca1a7174c7f826a0bcdd4b2c1ec59b0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::sandboxir::ConstantPtrAuth::hasSpecialAddressDiscriminator (uint64&#95;t Value) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Whether the address uses a special address discriminator.

These discriminators can&#39;t be used in real pointer-auth values; they can only be used in &quot;prototype&quot; values that indicate how some real schema is supposed to be produced.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l01123">1123</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
